thread.title: Here’s a Way to Limit Costs and Losses in a Bear Market

author: wsjcom
title: Here’s a Way to Limit Costs and Losses in a Bear Market
text: Prof. Burton G. Malkiel is correct to emphasize that “minimizing costs is a winning strategy” (“How to Invest in an Overpriced World,” op-ed, Jan. 23). This portfolio strategy was developed at the University of Chicago by Harry Markowitz, Merton Miller and Eugene Fama (each a Nobel laureate in economic sciences) beginning in the 1950s. What is usually omitted from the popular discussion, however, is the easiest low-cost and most straightforward approach to assure “gentler losses during bear markets.” For most investors the Chicago professors would suggest a no-load S&P 500 mimic fund insured against material loss...
